intro: Gynestum acaule, commonly known as the naked-stemmed gynestum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its lack of a distinct stem, with leaves emerging directly from the base. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Gynestum acaule is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
